meanings.sent1: Bullies victimise others by picking on them.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to victimise someone just because they are different.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to victimise the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to victimise the small town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was to victimise the innocent townspeople for his own gain.

meanings.definition: To treat someone unfairly or cruelly.
meanings.sent1: Some people victimise others out of jealousy.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stand up against those who victimise others.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten seemed to victimise the dog by stealing its bone.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter weather seemed to victimise the fragile flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The greedy landlord would victimise his tenants by raising the rent unexpectedly.
